corner of 38th Street.

(2)
The Lefcourt-Normandie Building on the site of the Hotel Normandie, seen from the roof of the Metropolitan Opera House across the clearing on the N.E. corner, where the Knickerbocker Theatre
has just been demolished.
March 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

717429f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at W. 38th Street, as viewed southeastward from the 21 storied Times Square Trust Company Suilding at the N.E. corner of Seventh Avenue and 4Oth Street. Shown is the excavation for the 35 storied NnickerbockerCaaieo Building at the N.E. corner. Across same apoears the towered 76 story structure (No. 1N84-8 Broadway) on the former site of the Hotel Normandie. To the extreme left is the 33 story Bricken-Casino Building at the S.E. corner of 39th Street. The low roof tops seen in the center foreground are atop the Metropolitan Opera House. Note in the baclground the indistirct outline of the New York Life Insurance 6ompany Building.
May 10, 1930.
P.L. Sperr  N26 288S

717449f.text:
Broadway, est side, from 39th to 38th Streets. vt the extreme left is the LefcourtManhattan Building. In the centre are the Bricken-Casino and the Kniokerbocker buildings, on the site of the Casino and Knickerbocker theatres. at the extreme right is the Lefcourt-Normandie Building,on the site of the old
Hotel Normandie.
1931.
Wurts Brothers.
NE32829

717438f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from and including 38th Street. In the centre background, from 39th to 40th Streets, is the Metropolitan Opera House. Beyond the Metropolitan is the twelve-story Emerson Building, and beyond that is the 33-story Bricken-Textile Building. Above this is the Times Building, and in the distance is the Hotel
Astor.
July 10, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

717430f-a.text:
1385-1391 Broadway, at the S.W. corner of West 38th Street. Struoture shown, is the 23-story Bricken-B'way Building. Adjoining same and partially
shown, is the Lefcourt State Building.
May 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr
